discussion.content: What is a ‘user export application usage’?

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text: Which solution allows an administrator to provision, monitor, and secure mobile devices on Windows and Mac computers from a centralized dashboard?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
provisioning is the key word " only ISE does provisioning" .

Selected Answer: D
I vote for D:

Configure Client Provisioning in Cisco ISE

Enable client provisioning to allow users to download client provisioning resources and configure agent profiles. You can configure agent profiles for Windows clients, Mac OS X clients, and native supplicant profiles for personal devices. If you disable client provisioning, users attempting to access the network will receive a warning message indicating that they are not able to download client provisioning resources.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-2/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_guide_22/b_ise_admin_guide_22_chapter_010110.html#task_3E2FCAEDD6BF4AD7B05A7AABB8AADCFE
Provision is tricky here. AMP covers mobile devices also these days. Not sure about provision from amp.

comments.content:
Even if Umbrella and AMP for Endpoints can secure mobile devices, that's not the true purpose of both solutions. Umbrella's true purpose is to provide DNS-layer protection and threat intelligence - it doesn't directly manage or secure endpoints. 
AMP for Endpoints true purpose is to provide malware detection and prevention - not centralized management and provisioning.

discussion.content:
I assume this is quite an old question. Now both Umbrella and AMP for endpoints can secure mobile device (even without usage of MDM).

However I am not sure what exactly is meant be "mobile devices on Windows and Mac", more accurate question is C - AMP for endpoints

source:https://umbrella.cisco.com/solutions/protect-mobile-users

comments.content: it mentioned "mobile device on Windows and Mac". i choose C.

discussion.content: AMP does not work with mobile devices
ISE can't be correct, I vote for C. Cisco AMP for Endpoint

questions.question_text: Which parameter is required when configuring a NetFlow exporter on a Cisco router?
Which type of encryption uses a public key and a private key?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Asymmetric or public key cryptography is the form of encryption that involves using public and private keys for encryption and decryption.

choices.D: devices such as routers and switches

discussion.content: D is the answer
Southbound is when it goes to the network devices

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D is correct since SBI(southboundinterface) mainly deals with data plane(network device) 

https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2995354&seqNum=2

https://ptgmedia.pearsoncmg.com/images/chap16_9781587147135/elementLinks/16fig05_alt.jpg

Selected Answer: D
A southbound API within a software-defined network architecture typically communicates with devices such as routers and switches
I think D is the right answer but C is correct also since the question is SDN in general, not just Cisco solutions.

comments.content: No, answer B is 'controllers within the network'. Correct is D

discussion.content: B. Controller to network devices.
